At that time, the World-Honored One was dwelling in the heavens, and with his superhuman, pure divine hearing, he heard such matters.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:

In the evening, he rose from his solitary meditation, went to the hall of ease, and in front of the great assembly, he arranged his usual seat, sat cross-legged, and with a clear and beautiful voice, he addressed the great assembly, saying:
Why have you gathered in this hall to engage in debate?
What are you discussing now that you have gathered here?
Then the great assembly said:
World-Honored One!
We gathered here and had discussions like this:
'Venerable Sirs!
The World-Honored One has used countless approaches to explain the profound twelve links of dependent origination, in which he first proclaimed ignorance as the causal nature.
For what reason, among all the causes and conditions of afflictions and karmic activities, does he only speak of ignorance as the causal nature?
What special insight does he have regarding this ignorance?'
World-Honored One!
For this reason, we engaged in debate. We have now gathered here to discuss this matter.
Having said this,
at that time the World-Honored One said to the great assembly:
I have such a distinguished Dharma door of dependent origination, you should listen attentively and contemplate it well, I will explain it for you.
What is called the distinguished Dharma door of dependent origination?
It is because of eleven kinds of supremacy that, in dependent origination, ignorance is proclaimed to be the nature of conditions.
What are the eleven?

Namely, the supremacy of objects, the supremacy of aspects, the supremacy of causes and conditions, the supremacy of arising, the supremacy of transformation, the supremacy of wrong practices, the supremacy of characteristics, the supremacy of functions, the supremacy of obstructions, the supremacy of bonds, and the supremacy of antidotes.
At that time, in the assembly there was a bhiká¹£u who rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, joined his palms in respect, and said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!
How is the supremacy of objects of ignorance?
The World-Honored One said:

The objects of ignorance are all the various defiled aspects that have many faults, whether as causes or as effects, and all the various pure aspects that have many merits, whether as causes or as effects. This is called the superiority of the objects of ignorance.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is the superiority of the characteristics of ignorance?
The World-Honored One said:
In this way, ignorance obscures the truth and manifests falsehood as its characteristics.
This is called the superiority of the characteristics of ignorance.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What is the superiority of the conditions of ignorance?
The World-Honored One said:

In this way, ignorance universally serves as the fundamental basis for the conditions of all the defiled aspects of afflictions, all the defiled aspects of karma, and all the defiled aspects of birth.
What are all the defiled aspects of afflictions?

That is to say, there are, in brief, three types of afflictive mental states that universally encompass all the defilements of the afflictions, namely, the afflictions of ignorance, the afflictions of doubt, and the afflictions of mistaken inversion.
What are all the defilements of karma?

That is to say, there are, in brief, three kinds of self-characteristics (i.e., bodily, verbal, and mental karma) and three kinds of distinctions in the counteragents to the three hindrances (i.e., meritorious, non-meritorious, and immovable karma), universally encompassing all the defilements of karma.
What are all the defilements of birth?

That is to say, there are, in brief, three kinds of bases (i.e., the three realms of desire, form, and formlessness) and three kinds of feelings (i.e., pleasant, painful, and neither-pleasant-nor-painful) that give rise to three kinds of suffering (i.e., the suffering of change, the suffering of pain, and the suffering of the formative forces), universally encompassing all the defilements of birth.
How does ignorance serve as the fundamental basis for the causal conditions of all the defilements of the afflictions, all the defilements of karma, and all the defilements of birth?ğŸ”½Herein,
It means there are two kinds of ignorance regarding the truths, which can cause all afflictions and defilements to arise when they have not yet arisen, and increase when they have arisen;
and can cause all karmic defilements to arise when they have not yet arisen, and accumulate when they have arisen;
and can also cause all defiled rebirths to arise when they have not yet arisen, and not cease when they have arisen.

Therefore, I say this ignorance universally serves as the fundamental basis for the causes and conditions of all afflictions and defilements, karmic defilements, and defiled rebirths. This is called the supremacy of ignorance as a cause and condition.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is the arising of ignorance supreme?
The World-Honored One said:

This ignorance either deludes the future self that is included in the truth of suffering, or deludes the present self that has already obtained a self that is included in the truth of suffering. Such delusion either attracts or is attracted by dependent origination, or either produces or is produced by dependent origination.
These two dependent originations are caused by the ignorance of one's future and present self.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How does the leading and led dependent origination arise?
The World-Honored One said:

The first is that ignorance leads to formations, formations lead to consciousness, consciousness leads to name-and-form, name-and-form leads to the six sense bases, the six sense bases lead to contact, and contact leads to feeling. This is called the leading and led dependent origination.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How does the producing and produced dependent origination arise?
The World-Honored One said:

The second is that ignorance leads to feeling, feeling leads to craving, craving leads to grasping, grasping leads to becoming, becoming leads to birth, and birth leads to old age and death. This is called the producing and produced dependent origination.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How is the first ignorance the causal condition for the leading and led dependent origination?
The World-Honored One said:
It is said that a certain type of person is ignorant of future rebirth and immediately gives rise to a desire for future existence.
Due to the ignorance that gives rise to a desire for future existence, one then sees the excellent qualities of future existence.
If in this present life one clings to desirable or undesirable objects, due to wrong discrimination, one creates non-meritorious actions.

Because of attachment to possessions, or because of hatred towards enemies, and due to being unable to discern the merits and faults due to the delusion associated with them, one creates these evil actions out of negligence and ignorance.
One is unable to contemplate the faults of future existences, and is unable to understand the characteristics of actions. Ignorance can create the conditions for these non-meritorious actions.
If one sees the excellent qualities of future existence, or sees liberation, one then creates meritorious or immovable actions.
Based on the teachings or the instructions, one gives rise to discernment and cultivation, and is thus able to create these actions.

You should understand that this kind of discernment and cultivation, even though they are in good thoughts, are not correct thoughts, and therefore they are attracted by the stupidity of a subsequent life, that is, by the stupidity that conceals the view of the excellence of a subsequent life and the stupidity that conceals the view of liberation.

These nonmeritorious, meritorious, and immovable actions, which are obstacles and antidotes, are born together with and perish together with the six consciousnesses, and they are able to place the actions in the present consciousness already obtained and already born that is retribution.
By this means, the three kinds of habit energy embrace the new seeds of a subsequent life.
Because they embrace the new seeds of a subsequent life, the name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling that are included in the subsequent life that will be born are born in sequence.

This name-and-form, etc., in the present consciousness already obtained that is retribution, only produces the nature of cause and not the nature of effect, and therefore it is only called the dependent origination that is projected.
This is called the first ignorance that serves as the condition for the arising of the conditioned arising of what is drawn and the drawing.
Again, he said:
World-Honored One!
How is the second ignorance a condition for the arising of the conditioned arising of what is produced and the producing?
The World-Honored One said:
There is a type of person who is ignorant of the present self-obtained body, and gives rise to craving for the feelings produced by the six sense bases as conditions.
Because of craving, one desires such feelings in the future.
Because of desiring, one gives rise to grasping when pursuing. The craving produced by pleasant feelings serves as a condition, giving rise to the grasping of desire.
What is called the grasping of desire is the false discrimination and craving for desires.
This is the foremost, this is the preceding, and then there are all the afflictions of the desire realm.

If, moreover, one gives rise to craving for nonexistence with painful feeling as its condition, accompanied by disgust and not drawn by false views, associated with disgust, relying on this craving, and seeking nonexistence through improper means, one then gives rise to the evil views of escape and the evil views of determination, as well as the evil views that are the basis of these two.
For this reason, it is called grasping with craving as its condition.

If one relies on this grasping and, without being free from craving for desire, dies, then all the evil views and all the afflictions of the desire realm are called grasping with craving for the desire realm as its condition.
If one is free from craving for desire or free from craving for form, then craving for the form realm or craving for the formless realm can give rise to a place of rebirth.

When the afflictions of the form realm or formless realm arise, one gives rise to grasping in the form realm or formless realm. For this reason, all the afflictions of the form realm and formless realm and all the evil views are called grasping with craving for the form realm as its condition and grasping with craving for the formless realm as its condition.
Due to this craving, one grasps at various karmic perfuming and ripening consciousnesses, which is called grasping.

Due to this grasping, the seeds of past accumulated karma and so forth are appropriated. If craving has not yet been eliminated in a certain realm, then the power of that [craving] manifests and can give rise to future existence.
Because these karmic activities and so forth can give rise to future births and cause birth to enter the present, they are called existence.
Because of the power of grasping, karmic activities and so forth become existence.
With this as a condition, from here one's life ends and the previously activated [karmic activities] gradually arise. For this reason, it is called existence giving rise to birth.

Once birth has arisen, the initial change in the stage of life is called aging, and the exhaustion of life at the very end is called death. For this reason, it is called birth giving rise to aging and death.
This is called the second ignorance, which is the enabling cause for the arising of the dependent origination of what is born and what gives rise to it.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
Why is it not said that craving and grasping can give rise to dependent origination and serve as conditions for karmic formations?
The World-Honored One said:
Craving and grasping have their own realm and scope.
Why is this?

It is unreasonable for craving and grasping in the desire realm to be the initiating conditions for the unmoving actions in the form realm or formless realm, because they are not the objects [of those actions].

Just as it is said that craving and grasping in the desire realm are not for the unmoving actions, so too are craving and grasping in the form realm not for the unmoving actions in the formless realm, and craving and grasping in the formless realm are not for the actions in the desire realm or form realm, and craving and grasping in the form realm are not for the actions in the desire realm.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
Why are craving and grasping in the desire realm not the conditions for non-meritorious and meritorious actions?
The World-Honored One said:

Due to the power of presently appearing agreeable and disagreeable objects, desire and love arise, unwholesome roots are activated, and non-meritorious actions are performed. All of this is due to not knowing the faults in non-meritorious actions regarding their causes and effects.
They give rise to non-meritorious actions due to either a fault in their intentions or a fault in their performance.
Such faults in intentions and performance are only used as the predominant conditions for ignorance, not for the love of objects or the unwholesome roots.
If one performs meritorious actions out of desire and love, they do so based on faith, because they have definite faith in death and rebirth.
This love and grasping are subdued by faith, and I designate them as hindered indeterminate.

If a dharma is hindered indeterminate in the desire realm, it has no superior ability to activate various actions, because it does not know liberation regarding causes and effects and meritorious actions, and performs these meritorious actions seeking a lovable rebirth. Therefore, these meritorious actions are also only used as the predominant conditions for ignorance.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
Why do the two kinds of craving and grasping in the form realm not serve as conditions for the unmoving actions in the form realm?
The World-Honored One said:
Those who have not yet abandoned craving for the desire realm have not yet attained the place of birth for craving in the form realm.
If there is no place of birth, then there is no ability, and therefore it is not a condition for the unmoving actions in the form realm.
As it is said that the two kinds of craving and grasping in the form realm serve as conditions for the unmoving actions in the form realm,
so should it be understood that the two kinds of craving and grasping in the formless realm serve as conditions for the unmoving actions in the formless realm.

They give rise to such improper thoughts and views regarding the form realm or formless realm, either based on the teachings or based on admonitions, and give rise to such improper thoughts that can serve as conditions for the unmoving actions in those realms.

The improper attention that is produced in this way is drawn by ignorance. In this way, ignorance, together with the improper attention that is its effect, is able to serve as the causal condition for the formation of the type of action that is neither happy nor unhappy.
Therefore, you should understand that the formation of the type of action that is neither happy nor unhappy is also due to ignorance as its dominant condition.

There is another type of person who, on the basis of craving for nonexistence, creates either meritorious or immovable actions. Because of this craving for nonexistence, he sees the many faults of the various forms of existence. How could he then hope for future forms of existence?
However, he does not understand nonexistence as it truly is. Because of his lack of understanding, he is unable to attain the true path of practice that is the antidote to existence.
Moreover, because of his lack of understanding, he takes what is not the antidote to be the antidote and creates either meritorious or immovable actions.

For this reason, you should understand that these actions are only due to ignorance as their causal condition, and not due to craving and grasping as the causal conditions for the formation of these actions.
He further said:
World-Honored One!

All the activities that are associated with and coexistent with the six consciousnesses, arising and ceasing together, what is the reason for saying that activities are the condition for consciousness?
The World-Honored One said:

Because the six consciousnesses are associated with and coexistent with meritorious, non-meritorious, and immovable activities, arising and ceasing together, the seeds of perfuming are placed in the consciousness of karmic retribution, attracting the new consciousness of karmic retribution in other lives.
For this reason, it is proclaimed that activities are the condition for consciousness.
Again, it was said:
World-Honored One!

Why are the seeds of the stages of name-and-form, six sense bases, contact, and feeling simultaneously attracted in the consciousness of karmic retribution, yet it is said that there is a sequence of earlier and later?
The World-Honored One said:
Because they arise in a sequence of earlier and later in the future, it is said in this way.
Again, it was said:
World-Honored One!
Why are name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling said to be the characteristics of the future body?
The World-Honored One said:
Because they are the basis for the experience of causes and the essence of the experience of causes.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
If there is only name and no form, what fault would there be?
The World-Honored One said:
If in one lifetime there is only name and it does not depend on form to abide, it would not be reasonable for it to continue arising.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
If there is only form and no name, what fault would there be?
The World-Honored One said:
If there is only form and no name to grasp and accept it, then it would disperse and disintegrate and not be able to grow.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
If one only says that consciousness depends on the six sense bases, what fault would there be?
The World-Honored One said:

When first receiving life, the six sense bases are not yet complete. There is only the body faculty and the mind faculty transforming. It should not be possible to take these two faculties as its essence.

Because name-and-form exists at the very beginning, it gradually increases and becomes the condition for the later complete six sense bases. Therefore, it is said that name-and-form is the condition for the six sense bases.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
If the six sense bases are complete and the body is fully developed, what is the reason for further speaking of the two, contact and feeling?
The World-Honored One said:

If the six sense bases are already complete in the body that has been born, although it is the ultimate basis for enjoyment, it is not yet called the ultimate enjoyment. It is only when there are causes and feelings that it can be called the ultimate enjoyment.
Therefore, you should know that it is necessary for the ultimate basis for enjoyment and the ultimate cause for enjoyment to be complete before it can be called the ultimate body that has been born.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
It is said that ignorance gives rise to craving as a condition, and it is also said that feeling is the condition for craving.
If only ignorance is the condition for craving, not feeling, what is the problem with that?
The World-Honored One said:

There are three kinds of craving, which should arise simultaneously at one time, because craving depends on feeling as a condition. They do not arise at the same time. For this reason, ignorance is not the only condition for craving.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
If that is so, what is the problem with saying that craving only has feeling as its condition?
The World-Honored One said:

All feelings should be the conditions for craving, but there is also feeling that is not the condition for craving. It can serve as a condition to cut off all craving. Therefore, feeling is not the only condition for craving.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
If it is said that craving only serves as a condition for becoming and not for grasping, what is the problem with that?
The World-Honored One said:

Desire for seeking is craving. There is no desire for seeking in the evil destinies. However, due to the non-meritorious actions one has done, even though one seeks for good destinies, the opposite result arises. When that result arises, how can it be conditioned by craving?
One should only say that it is conditioned by grasping.
Moreover, as it is said that there is no craving for non-existence, one desires for non-existence;
when seeking for non-existence, due to creating meritorious actions and immovable actions, the opposite result arises.
When that result arises, how can it be conditioned by craving?
One should only say that it is conditioned by grasping.
For this reason, it is not only craving that is the condition for becoming.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
If grasping is the condition for becoming, and becoming is the condition for birth, why is it not said that grasping and becoming are the truth of accumulation?
The World-Honored One said:
Because craving performs four kinds of actions: First, this craving is able to create the action of craving and attachment in the experience of one's own body and objects;
Second, this craving can create the function of giving rise to all grasping;
Third, this craving can create the function of causing the previously-drawn-in formations, etc. to become existent;
Fourth, this craving can create the function of continuing to be reborn after death.
For these reasons, it is said that only this craving is the truth of the origin.
He further said to the World-Honored One:
If birth, old age, death, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling are the characteristics, why is the name of birth, old age, and death shown for this born body?
The World-Honored One said:
In order to show that this born body has the nature of suffering formed by three kinds of suffering.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What suffering does birth show?
The World-Honored One said:
Birth shows the suffering of formations.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What suffering does old age show?
The World-Honored One said:
Old age shows the suffering of change.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What suffering does death show?
The World-Honored One said:
Death manifests the suffering of suffering.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What are the differences between these four kinds of bodily birth and birth, old age, and death?
The World-Honored One said:
These four kinds of bodily birth, if they are born in sequence, belong to that birth, and are born in this way, they should be known as the characteristics of the birth of the body.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What are the characteristics of the sequentially born body?
The World-Honored One said:

In the very beginning, there is the birth of planting seeds. Immediately after this, there is the birth of gradual increase. Immediately after this, there is the birth of emerging from the womb. Immediately after this, there is the birth of gradual growth.
Having grown up, one enjoys language and is able to attain birth of the same kind. This kind of sequence is called sequential birth.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
To whom do these belong?
The World-Honored One said:
The aggregates, realms, and sense bases have no self at all.
Why is this?
Because the aggregates and so forth gradually increase and grow, their nature is impermanent, and the impermanent dharmas have this characteristic of arising.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How does arising occur?
The World-Honored One said:
Due to the power of the life faculty, there is temporary abiding, because it is a limited dharma. Its nature is impermanent, and the impermanent dharmas arise in this way.
These four characteristics of the born body, when the time changes, should be known to be able to create five kinds of decline, which are called old age.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
What are called the five kinds of decline?
The World-Honored One said:
First, the decline of beard and hair, because the color of the beard and hair fades and deteriorates;
Second, the decline of physical characteristics, because the bodily form, complexion, and strength all decline;

Third, the decline of activities. When speaking, one's breath is short and rapid. The body trembles and shakes, so when standing one is bent over. This is because the waist and spine have no strength. When sitting, one is hunched over. This is because the body is weak. When walking, one must lean on a staff. This is because the body is feeble. Whatever one thinks, one's wisdom is dull. This is because one's memory is confused.

Fourth, the decline of enjoyment. One's current resources are inferior, so one cannot enjoy them. One cannot presently enjoy any playthings. One cannot quickly and clearly engage with the objects of the various sense faculties, or one does not engage with them at all.
Fifth, the decline of the life faculty. One's lifespan is about to end, as one is close to death. One cannot bear even a small cause of death.
Within these four bodily characteristics of birth, there are also six kinds of distinctions in death characteristics:

First, ultimate death; second, non-ultimate death; third, death by intrinsic nature; fourth, the characteristics of the distinctions in the divisions of non-ultimate death; fifth, the characteristics of the distinctions in the divisions of ultimate death; sixth, timely and untimely death.

One should know that among these, death by intrinsic nature refers to consciousness leaving the body, the characteristics of form disappearing and ceasing, the characteristics of distinctions. In this way, within the characteristics of name-and-form in the body, there are distinctions due to birth, aging, and death.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
In the dependent origination, three kinds of craving are mentioned, all of which are conditions for the body to be born.
Why is it that in many places, only the body born in the desire realm is mentioned?
The World-Honored One said:
Because the characteristics of the body born in the desire realm are the coarsest, easiest to understand, and not the path of regression and return to non-eternal liberation.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
As previously explained, the dependent origination of leading and the dependent origination of arising each have twelve factors. Among these factors, how many are able to lead?
How many are led?ğŸ”½How many are able to give rise?
How many are given rise to?
The World-Honored One said:
It should be known that among these twelve factors, ignorance, formations, and a part of consciousness are called able to lead;
Furthermore, a part of consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling are called led;
Furthermore, a part of feeling, craving, grasping, and becoming are called able to give rise;
Birth and old age and death are called given rise to. It should be known that a part of name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling are also called given rise to.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
Do these factors, whether leading or giving rise, arise simultaneously?
Or do they arise in sequence?
The World-Honored One said:
They arise simultaneously, but are explained in sequence.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
If these factors arise simultaneously, for what reason do you first speak of their leading and then speak of their arising?
The World-Honored One said:
Only when there is leading can there be subsequent arising, not without leading.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
Since ignorance also conditions improper attention, why do you only speak of ignorance as a condition?
The World-Honored One said:

Ignorance also leads improper attention to be a condition for volitional actions. Moreover, the contact and feeling born from ignorance are conditions for the arising of craving. Therefore, I speak of it in a biased way.
He further said:
World-Honored One!
How many aspects should one know in order to understand dependent arising?
The World-Honored One said:
One should know dependent arising through three aspects:
First, by knowing that dependent arising is without activity; second, by knowing that dependent arising is impermanent by nature; third, by knowing that dependent arising is capable.
